brandi & jason are getting married

07.15.17 | 11 am | Noble Rot Restaurant, Portland, OR

rsvp

Already RSVP'd?

Get to know the couple:

the journey

Brandi

Brandi is a California native who thoroughly enjoys reading, binge watching shows for the umpteenth time on Netflix and most types of physical activity. She spends her days as an Email Production Manager and her nights dreaming of running away to join the circus full time so she can get paid to wear brightly colored bodysuits while doing handstands on top of other humans.

Jason

Jason was born in Colorado but grew up in a suburb of Portland, OR. Growing up, he kept busy with video games, playing guitar, and entertaining a proclivity for computers. His earlier hobbies later translated into an intense passion for coffee, a serious rock climbing hobby and a career in web development. This kick ass site you’re perusing on your way to RSVP is a product of his.

The Road Ahead

Jason and Brandi met NYE 2014. They started climbing together with friends at a bouldering gym. Bouldering sessions with groups turned into bouldering sessions with only each other, which led to post-climb burgers. Burgers turned into late night coffee and talking about books, which led to inappropriate jokes and a penchant for getting pizza at 2am so they could sustain themselves while binge watching the Walking Dead. Now, they want to watch the Walking Dead for the rest of their lives together. Marriage is the obvious next step.

when + where

Saturday, July 15th, 2017 @ 11:00am

Noble Rot

1111 East Burnside
Fourth Floor
Portland, OR 97201

Parking

There is Pay-to-Park street parking along East Burnside for several blocks. There is also street parking in the residential area near

What to expect

The ceremony will take place on an uncovered patio, with seating offered in part of the patio and a covered portion an atrium with glass walls and no AC. The reception will take place mostly inside the restaurant, which does have AC.

Unplugged/Phone-free ceremony

We know it’s 2017 and all but we’re requesting that our very short and sweet wedding ceremony be completely unplugged and cellphone/camera-free. We’ll have a lovely photographer there to document the event. As soon as the ceremony is over, feel free to to pull your camera out for the reception and go crazy.

Info on attire

pdx guide

Accommodations (STAY)

Food (EAT + DRINK)

Activities (PLAY)

Shop at Portland Saturday Market and walk down row upon row of unique, handcrafted items, choose from a plethora of exotic foods to eat while listening to live music.

Visit Powell’s City of Books to explore the largest used and new bookstore in the world. It takes up an entire city block and holds approximately one million books spread through 9 color-coded rooms and over 3,500 different sections including out-of-print and hard-to-find titles.

Want to kick it in the outdoors? Visit the International Rose Test Garden or take a hike in Forest Park, Portland’s 5,200 acre urban forest. If you’d like more hiking options, hop in the car and head 35 minutes east and check out one of the many hikes in the Columbia River Gorge.

registry

We are so happy that you’ll be able to join us for our wedding. While the presence of your company is the only gift we could ask for, an alternative registry has been set up here for those who have expressed an interest in offering a gift to mark the occasion.

visit registry

We’d also appreciate any donations made in our honor to any of the following organizations that need the support:

The Trevor Project Mexican American Legal Defense Fund The Center for Reproductive Rights The NAACP Legal Defense Fund
We’re excited to celebrate with you! Kindly respond by 5/5/17
